AcAdjustmentType.title: Values:
AcAdjustmentType.description:
Values:

- cpfEmployee - A line of a document of type “salary” has an adjustment of type “cpfEmployee”. It is a deduction from salary to the government social security fund (at least in Singapore it is a CPF)

- discount - Include the discount amount for a line item

- nonUkTax - Represents taxes regarding “Non-UK“ tax rate. Only used for “nonUkTax“ tax rate.

- reverseCharge - Represents taxes regarding “Reverse change“ tax rate. Only used for “reverseCharge“ tax rate.

- vat - Represents taxes regarding VAT tax rates. Used for “vat“, “suspense“, “exempt“, “vatImport“ tax rates.

- vatWithheld - Represents taxes regarding “Marketplace withheld tax“ tax rate. Only used for “withheld“ tax rate.

ContactType.title: Values:
ContactType.description:
Values:

- bank - bank contact. So bank - is another side which deals with current company. It is type for a global contact, i.e. common for all companies.

- company - another companies which deals with current.

- government - governmental body or entity

- person - a human individual

- gateway - contact which represents different payment systems (gateways). It is type for a global contact, i.e. common for all companies.

- suspenseContact - special utility contact type. Used when contact was not able to be recognized automatically.

AcDocumentType.title: Values:
AcDocumentType.description:
Values:

- bankFee - charges to a customer with a bank account for various services provided by a bank or as penalties for specific activities of the customer.

- bankStatement - is an official summary of [financial transactions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_transaction) occurring within a given period for each [bank account](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_account) held by a person or business with a [financial institution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_institution). See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_statement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_statement)

- bankTransfer -

- bonus -

- cashback - a small amount paid to a customer by a credit card company for each use of a credit card.

- chargeback - is a return of money to a payer of some transaction, especially a credit card transaction. Most commonly the payer is a consumer.

- creditNote - is a commercial document issued by a [seller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seller) to a [buyer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buyer). Credit notes act as a [source document](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_document) for the sales return journal. In other words, the credit note is evidence of the reduction in sales.

- depreciation - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depreciation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depreciation)

- dispute -

- dividends - is a distribution of [profits](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profit_(accounting)) by a [corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporation) to its [shareholders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shareholder).[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dividend

- fee -

- gatewayFee -

- giftCard - is a prepaid [stored - value money card](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stored - value_card), usually issued by a [retailer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Retailer) or [bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank), to be used as an alternative to cash for purchases within a particular store or related businesses. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gift_card](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gift_card)

- grant - is a [fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funding) given by an end entity grant – often a [public body](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government), [charitable foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charitable_foundation), or a specialised grant - making institution – to an individual or another entity (usually, a non - profit organisation, sometimes a business or a local government body) for a specific purpose linked to [public benefit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_benefit). Unlike [loans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loan), grants are not to be paid back. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_(money)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_(money))

- initialAccountBalance -

- interest - is payment from a [borrower](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debtor) or deposit - taking financial institution to a [lender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lender) or depositor of an amount above repayment of the [principal sum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal_sum) (that is, the amount borrowed), at a particular rate. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interest)

- interestPayment -

- invoice - is a [commercial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commerce) document issued by a [seller](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sales) to a [buyer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buyer) relating to a sale transaction and indicating the [products](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Product_(business)), quantities, and agreed - upon [prices](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Price) for products or [services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Service_(economics)) the seller had provided the buyer. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invoice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invoice)

- loan - is the lending of [money](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Money) by one or more individuals, organizations, or other entities to other individuals, organizations etc. The recipient (i.e., the borrower) incurs a debt and is usually liable to pay [interest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interest) on that debt until it is repaid as well as to repay the principal. amount borrowed.

- manualJournal -

- marketplaceUnrecognized -

- openingBalance -

- openingBalanceBank -

- order -

- paidUpCapital -

- realisedCurrencyGainLoss - is the gain or loss of value of a country's [currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Currency) with respect to one or more foreign reference currencies, typically in a [floating exchange rate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floating_exchange_rate). See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Currency_appreciation_and_depreciation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Currency_appreciation_and_depreciation) system in which no official currency value is maintained

- receipt - see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Receipt

- reconciliation -

- refunds - a process in which a customer returns a product to the original retailer in exchange for money previously paid. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Product_return](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Product_return)

- salary - is a form of periodic payment from an employer to an employee, which may be specified in an [employment contract](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Employment_contract). See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salary)

- salaryDeduction -

- salesOrder - is an [order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Order_(business)) issued by a business or sole trader to a customer. A sales order may be for products and/or services. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sales_order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sales_order)

- salesOrderReturn -

- socialSecurity -

- taxStatement -

AcTransactionType.title: Values:
AcTransactionType.description:
Values:

- financial - Financial documents reflects financial transaction between bank account and counter - party, or between different bank accounts of the company (bank transfer). Only documents with type = ‘Bank statements’ has financial transaction type.

- material - Material documents reflect business transactions between the company and counter - party. The material transaction never reflects the fact of transferring money from one counterparty to another, but reflects a deal where some value is transferred between 2 counter - parties (e.g. sale of an Apple) and in most of the cases material transaction is reconciled with a financial one: therefore value inside a material transaction is given over pending financial compensation.

- none - Fictive transaction type that indicates internal fictive documents, e.g. reconciliation documents. If external document has transaction type None, it errors inconsistent state. Such a document will be rejected.

AcMovementType.title: Values:
AcMovementType.description:
Values:

- in - for income transactions

- out - for outcome transactions

- none - fictive movement type for special documents which are not related to money transfers.

AcDocumentOrigin.title: Values:
AcDocumentOrigin.description:
Values:

- ocr - this document was created by an optical character recognition system from a paper document

- manual - this document was created manually by a user

- integration - this document was created by a third - party

AcDocumentStatus.title: Values:
AcDocumentStatus.description:
Values:

- approved - initial document status. Is set for new document by default

- draft -

- paid - is set after document full reconciliation. Deals only with these document types: bankFee, interest, invoice, cashback.

- voided -

- deleted -

AcDocumentReconcileAdjustmentType.title: Values:
AcDocumentReconcileAdjustmentType.description:
Values:

- none - Partial reconciliation. The difference will become unreconciled

- foreignCurrency - Full reconciliation. The difference will become Currency gain/loss

- bankFees - Full reconciliation. The difference will become Bank fee

- chargeback - Full reconciliation. The difference will become Chargeback

- cashback - Full reconciliation. The difference will become Cashback

- interest - Full reconciliation. The difference will become Bank interest in/out

- auto - Full reconciliation. The choice of where the difference belongs is calculated automatically

AcDocumentCollectionStatus.title: Values:
AcDocumentCollectionStatus.description:
Values:

- draft - initial document collection status value. Is set by default.

- paid - this status is set by cron each day for all draft document collections created for today.

AcDocumentCollectionType.title: Values:
AcDocumentCollectionType.description:
Values:

- bankStatement - collection of bank statements

- payrun - not used

- payslip - collection of documents related to a single employee salary payout

- reconciliationCollection - collection of reconciliation documents related to one cash coding reconciliation

- openingBalance - collection of documents related to opening balance

AcReconciliationType.title: Values:
AcReconciliationType.description:
Values:

- manual - reconciliation performed manually via reconciliation ticket.

- auto - fast auto reconciliation performed for some types of financial documents like bankFee, cashback, interest. Subtypes: bankFee, cashback, interest

- api - reconciliation performed by direct API call.

- systemTags - can't find usage. Remove it.

- limits -

- optimisticAuto - reconciliation based on smart documents comparison (document contacts, dates, amounts e.t.c). Subtypes: contacts, reference, heuristics

- ecommerce - type for ecommerce reconciliations. Now it is used only for reconciliation of gateway transactions. Subtypes: accountTransfer, limits

AcReconciliationSubtype.title: Values:
AcReconciliationSubtype.description:
Values:

- accountTransfer - used for ecommerce reconciliation type.

- bankFee - used with auto reconciliation type for bankFee document type.

- bankTransfer -

- cashback - used with auto reconciliation type for cashback document type.

- contacts - used for optimisticAuto reconciliation type when documents were coupled by their contacts identity.

- gatewayFee -

- heuristics - used for optimisticAuto reconciliation type when document were coupled by smart comparison of document dates, amounts, e.t.c.

- interest - used with auto reconciliation type for interest document type.

- limits - should be used in future for ecommerce reconciliation type. It is a replacement for deprecated limits reconciliation type.

- reference - used for optimisticAuto reconciliation type when documents were coupled by bank transaction reference identifiers.

- reversedTransaction -

- cashcoding -

AcTaxRateType.title: Values:
AcTaxRateType.description:
Values:

- vat - Value-added tax in the United Kingdom. Currently 4 rates of VAT: 0%, 5%, 12.5% and 20%. Also used for GST in Singapore. VAT JE will be created depending on VAT percent. Affect VAT report. Can be used only with vat adjustment.

- suspense - Used when the tax rate amount is known, but the tax rate was not automatically recognized Doesn't affect JE and VAT report.

- exempt - This means that goods and services that are exempt from VAT are not taxable. Zero VAT JE will be created. Will be presented as “Exempt“ in the VAT report.

- reverseCharge - Used when a company from UK buys services from businesses who are based outside the UK. Doesn't affect JE. Will be presented in VAT report as Reverse change expense 20%. Can be used only with reverseCharge adjustment.

- withheld - The UK imposes a 20% withholding tax on non-residents who receive certain interest payments, rents or royalties from the UK. Doesn't affect JE. Will be presented in VAT report as “Marketplace withheld tax“ 0% VAT. Can be used only with vatWithheld adjustment.

- withheldNoVat - Marketplace withheld tax when sales took place outside the UK totally. Doesn't affect JE. Will not be presented in VAT report. Can be used only with vatWithheld adjustment.

- vatImport - Import duty is a type of tax payable on the value of imported goods. 100% of the total VAT JE will be created. Will be presented as “Import“ in VAT report.

- nonUkTax - Sometimes UK companies take “sales“ or other taxes when they sell outside of the UK. Creates an expense JE, not a VAT. Will be presented in VAT report as 0% VAT. Can be used only with nonUkTax adjustment.

- nonUkTaxNoVat - When sales took place outside the UK totally. Creates an expense JE, not a VAT. Will not be presented in VAT report. Can be used only with nonUkTax adjustment.

BkTransactionType.title: Values:
BkTransactionType.description:
Values:

- adjustment -

- atm - Deposit or withdraw funds using an ATM.

- bankCharge - Record a purchase on a credit card or withdraw funds using a debit card

- billPayment -

- cash -

- cashback -

- checkoutPayment -

- cheque - Transfer money from one account to another account

- directDebit -

- interest -

- payout -

- purchase -

- refund -

- sale -

- standingOrder -

- transfer -
